(1, 1, 2): CPR being administered during a simulation of cardiac arrest.
(3, 1, 1): Loss of consciousness, abnormal or no breathing
(5, 1, 1): Coronary artery disease, congenital heart defect, major blood loss, lack of oxygen, very low potassium, heart failure
(7, 1, 1): Not smoking, physical activity, maintaining a healthy weight
(10, 1, 1): 13 per 10,000 people per year (outside hospital in the US)
